DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the patient is receiving enzyme-inducing anticonvulsant medication.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the medication received by the patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A drug or substance that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease.

Concepts.definition: A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient receiving enzyme-i
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving enzyme-inducing anticonvulsant drugs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Currently on enzyme inducing anti-convulsants or other strong inducers (efavirenz, nevirapine, barbiturates, carbamazepine, phenobarbital, phenytoin, rifabutin, rifampin, pioglitazone) or strong inhibitors of CYP3A4 (indinavir, nelfinavir, ritonavir, clarithromycin, itraconazole, voriconazole, ketoconazole, nefazodone, saquinavir, telithromycin).  (See http://medicine.iupui.edu/clinpharm/ddis/table.asp for an up-to-date list of strong inducers and inhibitors of CYP3A4.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient receive treatment with clinically significant enzyme inducers, such as the enzyme-inducing antiepileptic drugs phenytoin, carbamazepine, oxcarbazepine, primidone or phenobarbital, or rifampin, rifabutin, rifapentine, or St. John's wort within 14 days prior to the first dose of MLN8237 or during the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received treatment with clinically significant enzyme inducers, such as the enzyme-inducing antiepileptic drugs phenytoin, carbamazepine, oxcarbazepine, primidone or phenobarbital, or rifampin, rifabutin, rifapentine, or St. John's wort within 14 days prior to the first dose of MLN8237 or during the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving non-enzyme inducing anticonvulsant drugs

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require enzyme inducing anti-convulsants to control seizures?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving non-enzyme inducing anticonvulsant drugs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient require anti-convulsants to control seizures?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received enzyme-inducing anticonvulsants within 14 days prior to enrollment?
